channel.title: Aryan! Where did the name come from?
channel.description:
I have wondered for a while where the name ARYAN came from is it something to do with Java lyk arrays or sumshit
PS: i obviously dont know what arrays are lol

item.title: Aryan! Where did the name come from?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

eLMafUDd:

The Aryan Race was what Hitler called his race of “Better” People (Blonde hair, blue eyes and such) And Aryan the bot means like the “Better” bot, But RegeX (the creator) was a jew hater imo, judging by his new website easybakejews.com

How can Christians hate Jewish people? Jesus was jewish, so that must mean that regex hates jesus.

It’s like all those weirdos who use the word Jew as an insult like…

“That’s so jewish”
“You stupid Jew”

It was like the time when everyone had the fascination of the word gay. All they did was replace gay with jewish/jew to come up with something even mroe insulting. I’m not jewish, but man I feel bad for those guys. I mean… a jew died on a cross very slowly for your sins… be grateful.

~Ron

PS: On aryan’s former website, they explained that Aryan meant Noble but yeah it was probably bullshit.

Read full topic

item.source: Aryan! Where did the name come from?

item.title: Aryan! Where did the name come from?
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

eXemplar already had a SourceForge project named Aryan – I think it was at one point intended to be a RSC server? I can’t remember. I believe he convinced Regex to use that name, it stuck, and we used the project for CVS. I then made innumerable jokes about it being the ‘final solution,’ the eradication of the lesser-thans, and so forth. Aryan is a common word in most Vedic languages; it means something more along the lines of noble than pure, but both are probably crappy approximations here. Wikipedia will explain it well, I’m sure.

While none of us are actually racist pricks, we do enjoy playing them on the weekends. Given that not a single bloody one of us would fit into the Nazi conception of Aryan, nor the original conception of it, it’s a little tough to believe we actually buy into it, don’tcha think?

As for easybake, eXemplar needed a domain name and couldn’t think of one. I said easybake. I didn’t expect him to actually register it, but I’m glad he did. I can now put toasty@easybake…com as a contact address.

Regex had absolutely nothing to do with it. Why does everything get blamed on him?

It’s called humour. Light-heartedness. Not being an uptight ass about everything.

Try it on for size.

Read full topic
item.source: Aryan! Where did the name come from?

item.title: Aryan! Where did the name come from?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

eLMafUDd:

The Aryan Race was what Hitler called his race of “Better” People (Blonde hair, blue eyes and such) And Aryan the bot means like the “Better” bot, But RegeX (the creator) was a jew hater imo, judging by his new website easybakejews.com

Actually, it wasn’t named intentionally to be racist. Originally, the word ‘Aryan’ meant pure…but since so many people mistook it for racism, I guess Regex got annoyed and decided to play on it (hence easybakejews.com)

Read full topic
item.source: Aryan! Where did the name come from?
